H0.text: By what more familiar name do we know the 'Angevin Dynasty' of English kings. Lancaster

H3.text: By what more familiar name do we know the 'Angevin Dynasty' of English kings. PlantagenÃªt

A4.text: The name Plantagenet is used by modern historians to identify four distinct royal houses: the Angevins...

A5.text: The term Angevin is the demonym for the residents of Anjou and its historic capital, Angers; the Plantagenets were descended from Geoffrey I, Count of Anjou, hence the term.

A6.text: The term Angevin Empire is a historiographic retronym defining the lands of the House of Plantagenet: Henry II and his sons Richard I and John.
